title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description:
Update the detailed requirements for the DeprecationDetective system as follows: 
* The types of codebases it should support (e.g., monolithic, microservices): Include support for serverless architectures as well.
* The programming languages and frameworks to be covered (specify versions where necessary): Initially focus on the top 5 popular languages (Java, Python, JavaScript, Ruby, PHP) and their common frameworks. Version specifications should cover latest LTS releases.
* The desired level of accuracy and performance: Strive for a precision rate of over 90% with a maximum response time of less than 10 seconds for individual code scans.
* User experience expectations such as UI/UX design and integration with IDEs or CI/CD tools: Design a simple, user-friendly web interface that integrates seamlessly with popular IDEs (Visual Studio Code, IntelliJ IDEA, Eclipse) and continuous integration tools (Jenkins, Travis CI).
* Edge cases that should be considered for deprecated code detection: Account for obscure or rarely used deprecated APIs, libraries, and dependencies.
* Key stakeholders and their specific needs within this project: Identify software developers, DevOps engineers, and technical leads as the primary stakeholders. Developers require a tool to help them maintain clean and up-to-date codebases, while DevOps engineers need assistance in automating deprecated code detection during deployment processes.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Develop the overall architecture for the DeprecationDetective system, including the main components, their interactions, and the data flow. Consider factors such as scalability, performance, and maintainability.

title: Implement Code Analysis Engine
description: Develop the core engine responsible for analyzing codebases, identifying deprecated code, APIs, and dependencies, and suggesting modern alternatives. This may involve techniques such as static code analysis, pattern matching, and machine learning.

title: Build User Interface
description: Design and implement the user interface for the DeprecationDetective system, allowing users to upload or connect to their codebases, view analysis results, and manage the update process.

title: Develop Integration and Deployment Strategies
description: Define and implement strategies for integrating the DeprecationDetective system into existing development workflows and continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines. This may involve creating plugins or extensions for popular code editors, IDEs, and build tools.

title: Implement Security and Access Controls
description: Develop and implement security measures and access controls to ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the codebases analyzed by the DeprecationDetective system. This may involve features such as user authentication, role-based access control, and secure data transmission and storage.

title: Create Test Suite and Quality Assurance Plan
description: Develop a comprehensive test suite and quality assurance plan to ensure the DeprecationDetective system functions correctly and meets the defined requirements. This should cover unit tests, integration tests, performance tests, and user acceptance testing.

title: Write Documentation and User Guides
description: Create detailed documentation and user guides for the DeprecationDetective system, covering installation, configuration, usage, and troubleshooting. This should include both technical documentation for developers and user-friendly guides for end-users.
